name: Super Mario Crossover Maker (Widescreen Edition)
description:
My 2nd itch.io game, which is just a widescreen version of my 1st game. My 3rd itch.io game won't be another variant of this game, I promise.

Original Game: https://turbowarp.org/760011099?size=640x360

Original Description:

Instructions Edit Mode: =================== 

- Click to place blocks 

- Arrow Keys or WASD to scroll around 

- Navigate the buttons on the side for more control over the level 

- Click on some things (Such as enemies or message blocks) to edit their properties. 

---------------------------------------------------------- Play Mode:  =================== 

- Arrow Keys to Move 

- Z to sprint 

- Space to jump 

- Click on enemies to damage them (Jump on Mario enemies instead) 

- Number Keys to cycle through hotbar 

- Up arrow to enter doors/portals 

- Walk or run into pipes to enter them 

=================== 

Share your level codes here: https://scratch.mit.edu/discuss/topic/612216/

Notes and Credits

A redone version of Mario X Minecraft 14.5, now with more blocks and more features that don't feature just Minecraft stuff, but a whole bunch of other stuff from Mario's neighboring franchises (Mostly stuff from the Mario X Other Games series). This project really tests the limits of Scratch. 

------------------------------------------------------------------

New features: 

- Layers: It is now possible to have up to 3 non-full blocks share the same tile space (A door sharing the same space as water for example)

- 10,000 Sub-Areas instead of 10 

- New Orientation setting (5) which mirrors the selected object

- 15x12 instead of 12x9 (20x12 now that it's widescreen now)

- A cleaner and more organized UI

- 2.5D physics 

- 200 enemy limit as opposed to 100 (Limit is also per sub-area now as opposed to the whole level) 

- Bigger levels (600x100 as opposed to 100x100) 

------------------------------------------------------------------

This is basically a watered down version of SMBX or a watered down version of BenjaminWins11's SMM3 project. Big shoutout to Turbowarp because this project was developed entirely on Turbowarp. Without it, this project would've been a nightmare and a half to code. Credit to @SpideyPlaysMC for the list data I used for the Auto-aligning tiles, and also for most of the SMW assets. The rest of the SMW assets came from spriters resource. 

Most assets belong to Nintendo and Mojang
